meanings.definition: To place or set on a pedestal.
meanings.sent1: She pedestalled the trophy in the center of the room.
meanings.sent2: The statue was pedestalled in the town square for everyone to admire.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully pedestalled itself on the top of the bookshelf.
meanings.sent4: His achievements were pedestalled by the community as exemplary.
meanings.sent5: The diamond was pedestalled in a glass case, sparkling under the lights.

meanings.sent1: The grand piano looked majestic in its pedestalled position.
meanings.sent2: The pedestalled vase added elegance to the room.
meanings.sent3: The cake stood pedestalled on the dessert table, tempting everyone.
meanings.sent4: The ancient columns were pedestalled structures of strength and beauty.
meanings.sent5: The pedestalled clock chimed melodically, marking each hour with grace.
